docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 19 Federal heart disease investigators reported today what was believed to be the first large sample of evidence linking the thickness of a person's blood with clots that cause strokes.

headline.main: U.S. Heart Study Links Clot-Caused Strokes to Thickness of Patient's Blood

docs.abstract: Dr I D Frantz repts optimism on use of drugs to reduce amt of fats in the blood that lead to arteriosclersis, strokes and heart attacks
docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 19 Federal heart disease investigators reported today what was believed to be the first large sample of evidence linking the thickness of a person's blood with clots that cause strokes.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: THE surgeon was a woman and she worked with skill and speed. Yet the visiting American surgeon at her elbow was less fascinated by her performance than by her earrings.

headline.main: Soviet Medicine Combines Old-Fashioned Methods and Ultramodern Techniques; 1917 The Russian Revolution 1967

docs.abstract: W Sullivan series on med in USSR
docs.snippet: THE surgeon was a woman and she worked with skill and speed. Yet  the visiting American surgeon at her elbow was less fascinated by her performance than by her earrings.

docs.lead_paragraph: LAST spring a delegation from the National Academy of Sciences went to Moscow to present the Kimber Genetics Award to Nikolai V. Timofeyev-Ressovsky.

headline.main: Soviet Genetics Reborn After Lysenko Period; 1917--The Russian Revolution--1967

docs.abstract: W Sullivan on rebirth of USSR genetics study after eclipse of Lysenko, article in NY Times series on 50th anniv of Russian revolution; rise and fall of Lysenko revd; work of Profs Dubinin, Engelgardt and others in restoring classical genetics outlined
docs.snippet: LAST spring a delegation from the National Academy of Sciences went to Moscow to present the Kimber  Genetics Award to Nikolai V. Timofeyev-Ressovsky.

docs.lead_paragraph: FOR the past three years, two New York City doctor husband-and-wife team of Vin cent P.
